data.shownotes: Surprise show announced the day before. This show featured the debut of Self-Immolate, Mars For The Rich, Venusian 1, Venusian 2, Perihelion, Inner Cell, Loyalty, Horology, Plastic Boogie, This Thing, The Bird Song, Melting, Boogieman Sam, The Cruel Millenial, Acarine, Murder Of The Universe, Planet B, Organ Farmer, Hell and Cyboogie. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Mars For The Rich, Planet B and Cyboogie have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Planet B and portions of Self-Immolate and Organ Farmer were released on the PHC FILMS YouTube channel. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Self-Immolate, Planet B, Gamma Knife through Billabong Valley, Cyboogie through Murder Of The Universe and Organ Farmer have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Self-Immolate was confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Billabong Valley was confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Hot Water featured Adam Halliwell on flute. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Self-Immolate was confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed and it contained Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. This Thing was introduced as a song about Joeys mom. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to their sound tech "Sammy José". Cyboogie was introduced as a song about Stu's grandma by Joey, with him also asking the audience for respect to let Stu sing about his grandma. After Cyboogie, Joey thanked openers ORB and Stonefield.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Work This Time contained a guitar solo for the first time. The Bitter Boogie contained Cyboogie teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Planet B through The Fourth Colour, Work This Time, Let Me Mend The Past and Self-Immolate through The Bitter Boogie were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. The Balrog and The Bitter Boogie were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. After Doom City, the Han-Tyumi voice said "Thank you Seattle" and a quote from Murder of the Universe multiple times. Wah Wah contained a River intro during which Joey thanked openers ORB and Stonefield, as well as containing The River quotes. 

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Mars For The Rich was introduced as a song about communism, followed by an audience member pulling the fire alarm which proceeded to go off for the next few songs. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Cellophane, Inner Cell through People-Vultures and Planet B through The River were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band came on stage. After Horology, there was a brief pause to fix Ambrose's microphone, in which Joey calls out "Somebody get this shrimp a microphone!". I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Cellophane tease. Before Boogieman Sam, 'Freak' (Silverchair) was teased.


Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Tezeta and Venusian 2 were on the written setlist but not played. Planet B was not on the written setlist. Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me I, Altered Beast I, Boogieman Sam and Robot Stop teases and quotes and Hot Water, Rattlesnake and Cellophane teases KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Planet B, Mars For The Rich and Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before the band as came on stage. Stu and Joey introduced Gaspard, their sound tech, after Murder of the Universe. The band shouted out their sound tech Sammy before Boogieman Sam. Joey thanked openers Stonefield and ORB before Self-Immolate. Sense was on the written setlist after The Bird Song but was replaced with Let Me Mend The Past.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. Joey dedicated Cyboogie to "the internet". Boogieman Sam was dedicated to "Sammy Boy". The Bitter Boogie contained Cyboogie teases, Cut Throat Boogie quotes and teases, and Boogieman Sam quotes. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Asheville ‘19. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on. I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Boogieman Sam tease. Nuclear Fusion was listed after Sleep Drifter on physical setlist but not played.
Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed and it contained Wah Wah teases.  Wah Wah contained a The River tease. Altered Beast IV contained an Altered Beast I quote. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Am I In Heaven contained an Alter Me I tease and quote, and Boogieman Sam and Robot Stop teases. Perihelion was on the physical setlist after Self-Immolate but was skipped due to time

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs was played for the first time known since 2015-12-09. (313 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Self-Immolate through The Great Chain of Being, Boogieman Sam and Wah Wah through Float Along - Fill Your Lungs were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Beginner's Luck was introduced as a song about Stu's gambling addiction. After Organ Farmer, Joey thanked openers Stonefield and ORB. Am I In Heaven? contained Mars For The Rich and Venusian 2 teases and Alter Me, Boogieman Sam and Hot Water teases and quotes KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Mars For The Rich, Alter Me I through Anoxia and Tezeta through Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in London ‘19. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Before Float Along- Fill Your Lungs, Joey thanked openers Stonefield and ORB. All of ‘Planet B’ along with portions of ‘Self-Immolate’ and ‘Rattlesnake’ from this show are featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 500

Evil Star played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Robot Stop teases. Wah Wah contained The River intro and teases. Cut Throat Boogie contained The Cruel Millennial outro. Head On/Pill featured Rattlesnake, Mr. Beat and Sea of Trees teases, Robot Stop, Hot Water, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, and Hot Wax quotes. Stu played drums for part of Head On/Pill, with Amby on lead vocals and guitar, and Cavs on keys. Cavs also began diving into the crowd and crowdsurfing during the time when Stu was on drums. Muddy Water was on the setlist, but not played. 'Murder of the Universe' and parts of the 'Head On/Pill' jam from this show are featured in the 'Chunky Shrapnel' concert film.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 400

Doom City was on the written setlist after Billabong Valley but was not played. Wah Wah contained a River intro and The River teases and quotes. Head On/Pill contained a flute solo from Stu, Rattlesnake teases and Alter Me and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. Stu’s flute solo from the ‘Head On/Pill’ jam is featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Venusian 2, Hot Water, Wah Wah, Road Train, Boogieman Sam and Head On/Pill have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band came on stage. After Billabong Valley a kid was invited on stage to hug the band. Am I In Heaven? contained teases and quotes of Pill, Boogieman Sam, and Alter Me. Organ Farmer was on the setlist before Am I in Heaven? but wasn't played. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Paris ‘19. Poster by Jason Galea Edition of 200

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gamma Knife, Her and I (Slow Jam 2) and Planet B were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This was the first 3 hour marathon-like concert, performed for fundraising and awareness of recent Australian bushfires, and the last concert performed with drummer Eric Moore. Evil Star intro song played from house speakers before the show. I'm Not in Your Mind contained a Cellophane tease. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Wah Wah contained The River teases and quotes. Willoughby's Beach was played for the first time known since 2016-06-25. (280 shows) Sea of Trees was played for the first time since 2017-04-02 (214 shows) and contained Head On/Pill teases. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Superbug was dedicated to the Coronavirus.

data.showtitle: Return of the Curse of Timeland
data.shownotes: This show was billed as Return of the Curse of Timeland (a rescheduling of their cancelled 2021 New Year's Eve Timeland Festival) and featured the debuts of Magenta Mountain, The Garden Goblin, The Dripping Tap, and Soy-Protein Munt Machine. Timeland was played over the PA as the pre-show music. A model of London’s Big Ben clock tower, approximately 20 ft (6 m) tall, with the words “Time is Ephemeral” and “Music is Ephemeral” written on the clock’s face was erected in the back right corner of the stage.  The clock hands ran forward at an accelerated pace throughout the show.  Am I in Heaven? contained Rattlesnake teases and Boogieman Sam quotes/teases. Evil Death Roll contained Robot Stop teases. Trapdoor was played for the first time known since 2016-09-09. (259 show gap) The Dripping Tap was introduced as a song about a tap that won’t stop dripping.  Smoke & Mirrors was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2018-06-20. (114 show gap) Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Rattlesnake contained Boogieman Sam quotes and featured another Cavs drum solo, during which the band destroyed the clock tower presiding over the stage and passed out the pieces into the crowd. The on-stage carnage appears to have extended to some of the band’s equipment, as the final portion of Rattlesnake was performed with Joey playing the FMB and Stu singing with no instrument.
data.opener: Babe Rainbow, Stonefield, Ajak Kwai, Nice Biscuit, Bones & Jones w/Folk BItch Trio

data.shownotes: Nuclear Fusion was dedicated to Skrillex. Stu did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. SPELLLING and Amyl and the Sniffers were shouted out after Plastic Boogie. Her and I contained Iron Lung quotes and Slow Jam 1 quotes. Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to Belgium (home of sound tech Gaspard Demulemeester) and contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes. Amby introduced The Dripping Tap as a song about his water bill.
data.venuename: Event Lawn at Virgin Hotels Las Vegas

data.shownotes: Superbug was introduced as a "song we wrote in 2019 about 2020". Wah Wah contained teases and quotes of The River. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Stevie Ray Vaughn, Jimi Hendrix, Steve Vai, John Butler, Joe Satriani, John Mayer and Korn were shouted out after Work This Time. Open Water featured a drum solo by Cavs and a Static Electricity tease. Straws in the Wind contained The Grim Reaper quotes. O.N.E. was introduced as "about being on tour". Boogieman Sam was dedicated to Sam, the band's sound tech, and contained quotes from Hate Dancin' and “La Grange” (ZZ Top). The Dripping Tap contained a Hell's Itch jam with lyrics and Hot Water teases.

Honey had teases from Billabong Valley and Sleep Drifter. Boogieman Sam had Cut Throat Boogie quotes. The Dripping Tap had I'm in your Mind quotes. After Honey, Stu says "give us that Tool beat", then says he was thinking of the wrong song and asks for that "Ginger Baker beat". Tezeta was played for the first time since 2019-10-07. (54 show gap) During Boogieman Sam, Stu was throwing some kind of food into the crowd, feeding it to the band, as well as tossing it in the air and catching it in his mouth.

I'm Not In Your Mind contained Am I In Heaven? and The Dripping Tap teases. The Balrog was played for the first time since 2019-10-16 (50 show gap). Wah Wah contained The River teases and Big Fig Wasp teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes, Cyboogie quotes, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes, and a "La Grange" (ZZ Top) tease, as well as Stu on flute. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Portions of Gaia and Magenta Mountain through Float Along - Fill Your Lungs have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Fourth of five nights in Barcelona for Primavera Sound. Am I In Heaven? contained Sadie Sorceress quotes and Hot Water teases. The intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by the entire band around one mic. 'Float Along - Fill Your Lungs' was listed on the printed setlist but not played. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Straws In The Wind, Nuclear Fusion, Sadie Sorceress, and Boogieman Sam have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

I'm Not In Your Mind contained Magenta Mountain teases. Ambergris was dedicated to the band's crew member Joe Santarpia.  The Lord of Lightning was on the printed setlist but not played, with Joey joking before Trapdoor that they only put Lord of Lightning on a setlist whenever there's a storm close to an outdoor show and it gets played if the storm hits, then he shouted out opener Jess Cornelius. Boogieman Sam contained I'm Not A Man Unless I Have A Woman, The Dripping Tap, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes and Cut Throat Boogie teases.

Poster By Daniel @sunflower_form

Converge (Demo) (or as it was known at the time, Uncolonize) played through the PA as the band walked on stage. Planet B was dedicated to the nearby wildfires. Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases. The Garden Goblin was introduced by Stu as a song Cookie wrote about Lucas, before Cookie clarifies that its about his dog in his garden. There were PA issues during Pleura and the show was paused midway through The Garden Goblin when the PA went down. During the pause the band reminisced about Radiohead's sound cutting out at Coachella 2017, a festival King Gizzard also performed at. Grace Cummings was thanked before Blame It On The Weather. Robot Stop contained Ice V quotes and Hot Water teases. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes and teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia through Robot Stop have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete or incorrect. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was part of the 2022 Desert Daze Festival (held on Moreno Beach at the Lake Perris State Recreation Area) and featured the live debut of Iron Lung. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, and “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes. Following Murder of the Universe the band shouted out Tame Impala, who also appeared at the festival. Following K.G.L.W. (Outro), Joey called out “our other best friends Mild High Club”, who were also playing that night, and Ambrose got them confused with Mildlife, another group the band was friends with playing the festival the next day. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs had a false start due to Stu's guitar being out of tune and contained a metal jam. The Dripping Tap was introduced as a song “about swimming in a sea of death”, and during the song Stu crowd surfed to and swam in Lake Perris, then crowd surfed back to the stage. The song contained Torture Chamber quotes.

Stu and Ambrose wished Joey a happy birthday during The Dripping Tap. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Oddlife was introduced as “Cookie’s favorite song”. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to soundman Sam Joseph and contained Cut Throat Boogie teases/quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes and Sleepwalker teases. Sea of Trees was introduced as “what King Gizzard was originally called” and “Lucas’s favorite song”, and contained Head On/Pill and The Bitter Boogie teases. Hypertension was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases. A New World through Altered Beast III featured Leah Senior providing narration. Alter Me I contained an Altered Beast III tease. Alter Me II and Altered Beast III were played for the first time since 2019-10-07 (90 show gap). The intro to Iron Lung featured additional vocals about “hot buns”. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Iron Lung was reprised during Mr. Beat. Joey was hit with silly string at the conclusion of the show, and Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) for the second night in a row. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea

This show was part of the 2022 Rhythm & Alps Festival. “The End” (The Doors) was briefly quoted after The Fourth Colour. Am I In Heaven? contained Witchcraft, Head On/Pill and The Dripping Tap teases. Amusing banter followed Am I in Heaven? where the band talked about their New Year’s resolutions. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo, during which Stu and Joey sprayed the crowd with champagne, followed by a full band “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease. Boogieman Sam contained “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes. Some other artists appearing at this festival were specifically shouted out by Joey: Marlon Williams, Sampa the Great, and Dope Lemon.

Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Sense was teased immediately before and during Ice V, which contained a Hypertension tease. Ambergris was introduced as “Joey’s porno song”. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to “time to party” and “everybody wants to party”, and Cellophane teases. Boogieman Sam contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “It's a Long Way to the Top (If You Wanna Rock 'N' Roll)” (AC/DC) quotes and Am I In Heaven? teases. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster By Lewy Jones

Stu joined the opener Los Bitchos on flute for their cover of Trapdoor. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases and had some of the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrains changed to "boogie, boogie, boogie". Automation contained a false intro with Cavs playing the drumbeat to Muddy Water. Honey contained Rattlesnake quotes (with the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrain changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels"), Sleep Drifter teases and O.N.E. teases. An audience member named Mīkal was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. The O.N.E. intro contained Straws in the Wind teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as a song about monkeys, then as a song about Lucas. Planet B was introduced as a song about monkeys, then space monkeys and finally "human monkeys". Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs followed by a brief metal vamp by the band. Planet B and Self-Immolate were dedicated to Michael Badger, a sound engineer/mixer on the studio versions of the tracks. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Witchcraft teases, Am I in Heaven? teases, The Dripping Tap teases/quotes and Hot Water teases/quotes with lyrics changed to "time to party". Cellophane contained "animals in Australia" quotes. The Balrog contained Evil Death Roll teases and Hypertension teases & quotes. Boogieman Sam had some of the "boogie, boogie, boogie" refrains changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels" and contained “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “Hells Bells” (AC/DC) teases, "animals in Australia" quotes, and Hypertension teases. Evil Death Roll and Presumptuous were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as being about “mountains and stuff” and had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu.” KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show has been confirmed, but only partial recordings exist. The full setlist was confirmed via the available recordings and written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations for missing or incomplete songs that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Amy Jean 100 Standard / 20 Foil

The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as being about “mountains and stuff” and had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu.” KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show has been confirmed, but only partial recordings exist. The full setlist was confirmed via the available recordings and written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations for missing or incomplete songs that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Amy Jean 100 Standard / 20 Foil

data.showtitle: Celebrating the Life of Broderick Smith
data.footnote: Shannon Bourne on guitar & Richard Tankard on keyboard
data.shownotes: This show was part of the public memorial service for Amby's father, Broderick Smith. Boogieman Sam featured Brod's long time musical collaborators Shannon Bourne on guitar and Richard Tankard on keys and contained Cut Throat Boogie teases and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “Boogie” (Carson), “My Babe” (Little Walter), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) and “Way Out West” (The Dingoes) quotes. "Don't forget to boogie.” - Broderick Smith

This show featured the debut of Witchcraft. This was “Drag Night”, in which the full band wore dresses and makeup in celebration of Tennessee’s “Adult Entertainment Act” (AKA anti-drag show law) being found unconstitutional by a federal judge. Rattlesnake contained Minimum Brain Size teases and was followed by a quote of “Signed, Sealed, Delivered (I’m Yours)” (Stevie Wonder) by Amby. Straws In The Wind contained a Swan Song quote. Gaia contained Motor Spirit quotes and teases. Boogieman Sam contained quotes of “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole). Following Magma, Joey announced that he and Cookie had been working on their flatpicking to play bluegrass and jokingly asked where Billy Strings was. Lava contained an “Unknown Legend” (Neil Young) tease. Head On/Pill contained Hot Water teases and Am I In Heaven? teases. Evil Death Roll was on the printed setlist but was not played. Poster By Jason Galea 560 Standard/ 150 Foil Print

An audience member named Seb was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion, which contained a Hell's Itch tease. Joey shouted out Dead & Co. after Minimum Brain Size. Gaia was dedicated to John Mayer ("the guitar slayer"). The River contained a Wah Wah tease. Boogieman Sam contained “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “Sweet Home Chicago” (Robert Johnson), “My Babe” (Little Walter), Cut Throat Boogie, and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “On the Road Again” (Canned Heat), Le Risque, and Head On/Pill teases, and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Chicago '23. Poster By Jason Galea 460 Standard / 130 Foil

This show featured the debut of Dragon. Am I In Heaven? contained teases of Hot Water and Witchcraft.

Poster By Elora Sperber

This show featured the debut of Kepler-22b. Gamma Knife contained a People-Vultures tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Magenta Mountain, Kepler-22b, Straws In the Wind, Magma, Gamma Knife, Iron Lung, and Han-Tyumi through Murder of the Universe have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jessica Rassi 130 Printed

The Grim Reaper featured “I’m the Shrimp Reaper” vocals and contained quotes of Torture Chamber, Sadie Sorceress, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “One, Two, Freddy’s Coming For You” (A Nightmare on Elm Street) with lyrics changed to “Shrimpy’s coming for you.” Static Electricity was introduced as a song about the time Stu almost got electrocuted in Thailand. O.N.E. contained Straws In The Wind teases. Boogieman Sam contained Rattlesnake quotes, The Bitter Boogie teases and quotes; “La Grange” (ZZ Top) teases and quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, The Dripping Tap teases, “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases and “Tutti Frutti” (Little Richard) quotes. The Dripping Tap contained Hell's Itch teases and a Witchcraft jam. Poster By Job van Rijen

Boogieman Sam contained Daily Blues quotes. The Dripping Tap was dedicated to Cavs' dad who lives in Deniliquin and is an "amazing plumber." Prior to Willoughby’s Beach, which was played for the first time since 2022-04-18 (122 show gap), the band mentions they had to bring their amps from home. Joey mentions his replacement amp makes him sound like he's in The Vines and teased the intro to “Can't Stop” (Red Hot Chili Peppers). Gaia featured a Motor Spirit jam and a drum solo by Cavs. Slow Jam 1 was on the written setlist after Iron Lung and Rattlesnake was on the written setlist after Billabong Valley, but they were not performed.

This show featured the debut of Sad Pilot. Gamma Knife contained a Motor Spirit tease. Mr. Beat contained a Sea of Trees tease. Boogieman Sam contained an East-West (The Butterfield Blues Band) tease. Hot Water featured Ambrose on saxophone and Witchcraft teases. Sea of Trees contained Hot Water and Ice V teases, a Chang'e (Extended) jam with lyrics and Motor Spirit quotes and Ambrose on saxophone. Nuclear Fusion included a fan named Elenie providing the vocal intro. Minimum Brain Size was introduced as a song about Neanderthals. Straws In the Wind contained Daily Blues, Smoke & Mirrors, and Iron Lung quotes. Self-Immolate was dedicated to Jason Galea and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Gaia also featured a drum solo that ended with a “Down Under”(Men at Work) tease by Cavs. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

Grace Cummings returned from illness as the opening act. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics. Boogieman Sam contained a Sad Pilot jam with lyrics, "Midnight Rambler" (The Rolling Stones) quotes, and “Boogie” (Carson) teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap was dedicated to "everyone with diarrhea" and contained a You Can Be Your Sillouhette jam and Mycelium quotes. The Wheel was dedicated to David, the band's bus driver. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Self-Immolate contained a drum solo. Following Converge, Joey shouted out opener Grace Cummings. Witchcraft was on the printed setlist after Converge, but was skipped. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Field of Vision. Daily Blues was preceeded by a Rock and Roll (Led Zeppelin) tease. Gamma Knife contained a Motor Spirit tease. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie and Work This Time teases, a Hog Calling Contest vocal jam, and Rats In The Sky quotes. I'm Not In Your Mind contained You Can Be Your Silhouette and Crumbling Castle teases. Cellophane contained Altered Beast teases. Before This Thing, which was introduced as a song about Ambrose and had alternate "New York City" lyrics, Converge was teased. After This Thing, Joey and Stu shouted out "Raygun", the Australian Olypmic breakdancer. Self-Immolate was introduced as a song about God. Straws In The Wind was dedicated to Alex Harvey.  Doom City contained an intro jam. Nuclear Fusion was not on the the printed setlist and featured an audience member (Gabby) on vocals. Rattlesnake contained Honey, Nuclear Fusion, and Oddlife teases, a Field of Vision quote, and Sleep Drifter teases and quotes.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 600
Holographic Edition of 150

Hypertension contained Boogieman Sam teases and quotes and Ice V teases. Ice V contained Hypertension and Blindness (The Fall) teases. Antarctica contained an outro jam without drums for Cavs to take a piss break. Before Gaia, Stu joked about how Supercell sounds like "soup for sale". Gaia contained a drum solo during which fans gave shirts to Stu. Before Mars For the Rich Stu put a hat (that he had earlier picked up from the stage) on backwards, jokingly compared himself to Lleyton Hewitt (an Australian former tennis player who was known for wearing hats backwards), and imitated his trademark fist pump. Swan Song (#2) contained Dragon quotes. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition - 200

data.footnote: Show resumed after 22 minute Rain Delay
data.shownotes: This show took place during an unrelenting rain storm. The Dripping Tap concluded with the Streets of Cairo tease from I'm Not In Your Mind. Following Tap the band left the stage for approximately 22 minutes due to the dangers posed by wet equipment, which was repositioned to be out of the rain during the break. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie teases. Amby quoted Singin' In the Rain (Arthur Freed/Nacio Herb Brown) in Daily Blues. Prior to Le Risque Joey shouted out Portugal. The Man. Following The Fourth Colour, Amby quoted Can't Keep My Eyes Off Of You (Frankie Valli) with lyrics changed to "I love you Portland" and John Gourley (of Portugal. The Man) came on stage and gave the band shots. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo with a Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) tease. Supercell was introduced as a song about storms. The Lord of Lightning contained an extended outro with a Cellophane tease. The Balrog was last played 2023-03-20. (85 show gap) Poster By Jason Galea Standard: 600 Rainbow Foil: 200

Slow Jam 1 contained Crumbling Castle and Am I In Heaven? teases. This Thing contained Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. Am I In Heaven? contained The Land Before Timeland, Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Witchcraft teases and a Slow Jam 1 jam with lyrics, and featured improvised alternate lyrics. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs. Nuclear Fusion featured community taper Mystery Jack for the vocal intro. Hog Calling Contest was teased prior to Antarctica, which contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Boogieman Sam contained La Grange (ZZ Top) teases and a Riff Raff (AC/DC) jam. Following Boogieman Sam, Joey mentioned that the band would be performing at the Hollywood Bowl with the L.A. Philharmonic on their upcoming tour in 2025, which was previously unannounced at the time. Texas Flood and Pride and Joy (Stevie Ray Vaughan) were teased prior to Daily Blues, which contained Hot Water teases. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases, This Thing quotes, Forty Six and 2 (Tool) teases and Master of the Universe (Hawkwind) teases and quotes. Gamma Knife was unfinished. Ice V contained The Lord of Lightning teases. The Lord of Lightning contained Cellophane teases. Le Risque featured Jay Weinberg on drums. Additionally, Cavs got an audience member to perform a laugh for the song and brought Jay's wife Chloe on stage to perform the 'Let's Ride' vocal part. Following Le Risque, Amby quoted I Love L.A. (Randy Newman).

Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. This Thing contained an Incredible (M Beat) quote. Crumbling Castle contained a Loyalty tease. The Fourth Colour contained teases of Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Forty Six and 2 (Tool).  Nuclear Fusion's intro was sung by an audience member named Rob. Prior to Intrasport, Ambrose and Stu gave Lucas a shoutout for playing guitar on the track and Ambrose introduced a gong solo from Cavs. Set contained an Ice V tease. Ambrose introduced Antarctica as a song Cook wrote about his love of air conditioning. Joey tried to imitate Jacob Collier by instructing the audience to do throat singing before Black Tooth. Iron Lung contained People-Vultures teases.  Le Risque was introduced as a song about a little grey mouse and contained a Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) tease. Boogieman Sam was preceded by teases of Riff Raff (AC/DC), Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) and Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC), and contained a Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) jam with Field of Vision quotes and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. This led to a People-Vultures jam with Muddy Water teases and Iron Lung and Phantom Island quotes.  Mirage City was on the written setlist after Antarctica but was not played.

Antarctica was dedicated to "all the polar bears in denial" and contained Daily Blues quotes and Ice V and Block of Ice (Osees) teases. Ice V contained Head On/Pill and Blindness (The Fall) teases. Gamma Knife contained Converge teases.  People-Vultures contained Iron Lung teases & quotes and Phantom Island quotes. Stu said "Free Palestine" before Boogieman Sam, which contained an Eternal Return vocal jam, Am I In Heaven? teases and a Riff Raff (AC/DC) tease. Slow Jam 1 contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Am I In Heaven? was unfinished and contained a Sad Pilot jam and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. The intro to Self-Immolate contained Am I In Heaven? teases and a drum solo where Stu, Joey, and an audience member shaved most of Stu's head.

data.jamchart_notes: An uptempo and “evil” version featuring unknown quotes from Ambrose.
data.shownotes: Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2023-06-16 (96 shows), Alter Me I was played for the first time since 2024-05-18 (64 shows), and Altered Beast II was played for the first time since 2024-03-14 (72 shows). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? and Head On/Pill teases. Boogieman Sam featured a guitar/harmonica duel between Joey & Amby and contained teases of Sad Pilot & The Bitter Boogie, a Mirage City jam, Altered Beast II teases and Phantom Island quotes. Chang'e was unfinished. After Hell, Joey introduced the rest of the band, followed by Stu introducing Joey. The audience then chanted "free free Palestine!"; the band encouraged them to "say that shit louder!".
data.soundcheck: Altered Beast Suite, Venusian 1, Predator X, Mirage City

data.shownotes: This show was played with The National Symphony Orchestra conducted by Sarah Hicks. During Grow Wings and Fly, Joey spoke about how even though Phantom Island talks about the band missing their families, the fans make it worth it. Following that, he said Free Palestine. Cut Throat Boogie featured a guitar/harmonica duel between Joey and Ambrose and was unfinished. Boogieman Sam contained Sad Pilot and Cut Throat Boogie teases. Only parts I, II, and IV of The River were performed. Before Dragon, the band mentioned Animal Collective's album Merriweather Post Pavilion, which was named after the venue.

Slow Jam 1 featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. Empty was performed for the first time since 2014-12-19 (644 show gap), and was performed with flute for the first time. Hot Wax was played by request of Wayne Gordon (who recorded I'm In Your Mind Fuzz and Quarters! at Daptone Studios and made a brief appearance on stage) and contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. A fan named Callum was brought onto stage to play Superbug on Stu's guitar instead of Stu. Magenta Mountain contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) and Magma teases. The Grim Reaper contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) teases and Intergalactic, Sabotage (both Beastie Boys), and Torture Chamber quotes. Following The Grim Reaper, Joey said he was ripping off Wes Borland (of Limp Bizkit), and Ambrose said he needed a red hat (Fred Durst's signature hat). Swan Song contained Magenta Mountain teases and quotes. Le Risque featured Jay Weinberg on drums instead of Cavs. Ice V featured Joey on flute during the intro and contained a quote of Aqualung (Jethro Tull) and teases of Ants & Bats and Blindness (The Fall). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Hot Water contained I'm In Your Mind and Robot Stop teases.  Following Hot Water, Joey shouted out festival act The Mystery Lights, saying they were the first band they co-headlined with in America. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie, Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. During Straws In The Wind, Ambrose walked through the crowd to Jason at the soundboard and when he returned to stage, he did an impression of Fred Durst. After Straws In The Wind, the band pretended it was Jason's birthday and sang Happy Birthday to him. During Pleura, Joey said "Fuck Donald Trump", with Ambrose responding "Juicy [Jason] for President!" Dimathaya Burarrwanga and Yimila Gurruwiwi from King Stingray joined the band for Rattlesnake on yiḏaki (didgeridoo), and Dimathaya quoted Treaty (Yothu Yindi). At the end of the show, Joey said Free Palestine and Ambrose led the crowd in a chant of "Free Free Palestine".
